abstract: Attorney G Oliver Koppell, former Bronx councilman, New York State assemblyman and state attorney general who pushed for bottle-redemption law that passed in 1982, files class-action suit against Walgreen Company on behalf of people who make living redeeming bottles, saying company has violated law; charges that Duane Reade stores, which are owned by Walgreen, have turned away and harassed people attempting to use service.
lead_paragraph: The complaint from G. Oliver Koppell charges that the company turns away and even harasses people who depend on the income from collected bottles and cans.

headline.main: Father of ‘Bottle Bill’ Sues Walgreen Over Bottle Redemptions
headline.print_headline: Walgreen Is Sued Over Bottle Redemption

snippet: The complaint from G. Oliver Koppell charges that the company turns away and even harasses people who depend on the income from collected bottles and cans.
